ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5h
8 hours
On average 10-15 hours per week. But it's worth it. I think it should maintain the current workload.
10-20 hours per week
Atleast 20 hours.
15hrs/week
6-8 hours.
I typically was able to spend 6 hours on average.
it really depends on how complicated codes I was working on, normally the hours would be around 10/week
more than 10 hrs

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great course.

Contents were fine. Wouldn't mind if Hamiltonian Marte Carlo could have been promoted to formal course content and spent more time on, in lieu of or on top of Metropolis-Hasting. Homework got increasingly annoying by sucking out way too much time -- time that should have been spent on doing thesis research! Midterm was hard! Especially hated the second question with the terms multiplying each other. The hint "taking the log" didn't make much sense either -- knew what taking the log was but didn't know you could do it that way in that context! Happy with the percentage of the grade it carries though.
It's an advanced statistics course. I sometimes couldn't understand the class contents well, but with the homework assignments, I could catch up.
I think it's an excellent course. I learned a lot from the lectures and hands-on practices. The only problem is that the workload is relatively heavy, but I do not consider it as weakness.
Good.

strength: get familiar with computational methods in optimization, especially newton methods, EM algorithm. weakness: the workload is not distributed uniformly, there is one week I have to work 15 hours on the homework, but eventually I gained knowledge and technique, so no complain at all.
Computational algorithms are intriguing especially when implementing them by ourselves. Also the math or deduction involved is moderate and acceptable.
Great course and nice teacher. Recommend it !
Great!
Great course combining the theoretical derivation with the computational implementation.

I thought the class was excellent. It was very demanding and I'd recommend that future students put a lot of thought into how much time the other classes in their schedule allowed them to allocate to this class.
Great course! Prof. Crawford uses simple but clear example to illustrate methods, and follows up by more advanced homework, which, together, greatly advances my insights into computational stat.
Strengths: Topics are excellent and useful. Weakness: Sometimes explanation is not clear enough.
Strength: great material , great office hour support Weakness: too much work

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Very good lecturer -- a rare find at Yale really. Well-paced. Always gives meaningful motivation and context for the next topic coming up. Likes to draw pictures. Not too concerned with unnecessary mathematical proofs, unlike pretentious pure mathematicians. Very clear. A bit of a tendency to keep changing office hours though.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He gave us the lecture very well. Some analytical concepts were difficult to imagine; he used several examples and make us understand them.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He's an excellent instructor, who explains everything in very understandable fashion even for student like me who do not have a mathematical background.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Good.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Professor Crawford is great. He is kind and nice, totally available to students. His course materials are also interesting.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  I like his way of teaching, very clear, covers topics that I really interested in.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Lectures are organized in a great pace. Topics covered are relevant and moving forward step by step.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is really responsible and good at teaching. Very patient to answer any questions and prepare the course with heart.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Clear. Useful
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor was great.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Prof. Crawford is patient, helpful, and can be reached almost all the time. His lecture was clear and insightful, his office hour is also helpful and popular.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Awesome, very willing to help student in class or after class.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is good and honest
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is great

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Useful content. Good lecturer. Homework means lots of work and can be challenging. Take-home final.

I'd recommend the course if you already know the basic concept of statistics. The class contents are advanced and haven't well documented yet as book. The contents are important for accurate analysis for complex data set.

I would definitely recommend it to another student who wants to develop or modify existing statistical methods in his/her own study. But I would not recommend it to students who do not have experiences of using the statistical tools prior to the course.
Good.

I think the course has too much workload compared with the lecture hours. Usually it takes too long time to figure out the homework questions, extremely time-consuming. I think a longer lecture and less homework workload would be better.
Very responsible and helpful during office hours and he is also willing to respond to our questions through emails
I strongly recommend it
Intensive exposure to computational problems and programming.
It is absolutely one of the best course of BIS. The workload maybe a little bit much but you can learn a lot from it.
This course is very useful. All strategies of algorithms instructed by Forrest are very clear. We can also learn how to use them by homework.

I thought the class was excellent. It was very demanding and I'd recommend that future students put a lot of thought into how much time the other classes in their schedule allowed them to allocate to this class.
i would recommend his course to others.
It is great, just a lot of work
